articles.title: Court strikes down California law on election-related AI deepfakes
articles.summary: The law came amid increased concerns about the quick advancement of artificial intelligence and its effects on political candidates.

articles.title: OpenAI Eyes $500 Billion Valuation in Share Sale Talks | The Pulse 8/06/2025
articles.summary:
OpenAIÂ is in early talks about a potential sale of stock for current and former employees at a valuation of about $500 billion, people briefed on the investment discussions said, marking an enormous gain in value for the artificial intelligence leader. The company is targeting a secondary stock sale in the billions of dollars, the people said, asking to remain anonymous because they werenâ€™t authorized to discuss the matter publicly. If the deal goes ahead, it would elevate OpenAIâ€™s on-paper price tag by roughly two-thirds. In trade news, President Donald Trump said heâ€™d impose increased tariffs on countries buying energy from Russia while clarifying that levies on semiconductor and pharmaceutical imports would be announced â€œwithin the next week or so.â€Â 
Today's guests: Kim Crawford, JPMorgan Asset Management Global Rates Portfolio Manager, Karsten Munk Knudsen, Novo Nordisk CFO (Source: Bloomberg)

articles.title: U.S. charges Chinese nationals with illegally exporting chips to China
articles.summary: Two Chinese nationals residing in California have been arrested and charged with violating export control laws by allegedly shipping advanced microchips used in artificial intelligence to China.
